headline: Airline CEOs meet with VP Vance to discuss shutdown impacts
summary: As the US government shutdown has continued for nearly a month, major airline executives met with Vice President JD Vance at the White House on Thursday to communicate how the shutdown could impact the industry if it drags on further. Yahoo Finance senior reporter Pras Subramanian comes on Market Domination to discuss the roundtable event, which included United Airlines (UAL) CEO Scott Kirby, American Airlines (AAL) CEO Robert Isom, and several union leaders. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Airline stocks tumble as shutdown threatens travel disruptions
summary: Investing.com -- Airline stocks tumbled on Thursday as concerns mounted that the ongoing government shutdown is disrupting air travel and could worsen during the busy Thanksgiving season. United Airlines (NASDAQ:UAL) fell 3%, Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL) dropped 2.4%, American Airlines (NASDAQ:AAL) declined 2%, and Southwest Airlines (NYSE:LUV) slipped 1.5%.

headline: TD Cowen Raises United Airlines (UAL) PT to $138, Cites Post-COVID Stability and UnitedNext Strategy
summary: United Airlines Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ:UAL) is one of the most undervalued large cap stocks to buy right now. On October 20, TD Cowen raised the price target on United Airlines to $138 from $127 and kept a Buy rating on the shares as part of an update on the estimates following its Q3 2025 results, […]
